page.title: 04ST. LUKE'S STOKE PRIOR
page.content: On Tuesday 4th June we (Form 2T) visited{St Luke's church}in Stoke Prior, which is situated on a mound overlooking the old part of the village, with its now disused pump. The church looks old, but was completely rebuilt in the{Gothic style by{George Colley of London in 1863. There is a picture of the former church just inside the door. We looked for old gravestones in the churchyard and found one for 1804, though there were stone tablets from the 17th c. inside the church. At the time of{Domesday}Stoke Prior belonged to the{manor of Leominster. Services are held in the church on Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday.
